tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE traffic_conditions (
  id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  location VARCHAR,
  traffic_intensity INT,
  weather_conditions VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE TrafficConditions (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    road_name VARCHAR(255),
    traffic_intensity INT,
    weather_condition VARCHAR(50),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE Routes (
    route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    start_location VARCHAR(255),
    end_location VARCHAR(255),
    distance FLOAT,
    estimated_time INT
)

CREATE TABLE Users (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(255),
    preferred_route_id INT
)

CREATE TABLE traffic_reports (
    report_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    camera_id INT REFERENCES traffic_cameras(id),
    congestion_level INT,
    road_condition VARCHAR(50),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE traffic_routes (
    route_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    start_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    end_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    estimated_time_minutes INT,
    route_status VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE traffic_users (
    user_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    last_login TIMESTAMP,
    role VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE traffic_conditions (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    congestion_level INT,
    weather_conditions VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE route_planning (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    start_location VARCHAR(255),
    end_location VARCHAR(255),
    distance FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE navigation (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    route_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    coordinates VARCHAR(255),
    speed FLOAT,
    eta TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE traffic_cameras (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    camera_type VARCHAR(50),
    status VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE incidents (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    incident_type VARCHAR(50),
    description TEXT
)
